title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:

C. Yesh Atid

D. Yisrael Beiteinu

---

2. Two telematics firms merged. What do these particular firms do?

A. Monitor people's driving habits (usually for insurers)

B. Make wireless devices controlled by brain waves

C. Optimize satellite navigation for truckers

D. Distance learning

---

3. Michelle Leung runs a China-focused investment fund with an unconventional approach. What is it?

A. She zeroes in on firms with strong Communist Party support.

B. She shorts Hong Kong real estate.

C. She avoids companies that have yet to turn a profit.

D. She likes out-of-favor energy producers.

---

4. President Biden met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in a building overlooking which of these?

A. The Ringstrasse

B. The Eiffel Tower

C. The Reichstag

D. Lake Geneva

---

5. Nutmeg is so popular that even JPMorgan is buying. Why?

A. The spice boosts immunity against Covid.

B. The analgesic qualities of the leaves make it a popular painkiller.

C. The Connecticut builder is overwhelmed by demand for homes.

D. The U.K. digital wealth manager will help the bank grow in Britain.

---

6. A new exhibit in New York called "Fotoclubismo" focuses on Brazilian Modernist photography by a group of amateurs -- in which city?

A. Rio de Janeiro

B. Sao Paulo

C. Brasilia

D. Curitiba

---

7. Fed officials expect to raise interest rates sooner than previously anticipated. When do most think it will happen?

A. 2186

B. Early 2022

C. Late 2023

D. Mid-2024

---

8. Who was just named to head CIA espionage operations?

A. Ann Marlowe

B. Christopher Marlowe

C. David Marlowe

D. Philip Marlowe

---

ANSWERS

1. B

2. A

3. C

4. D

5. D

6. B

7. C

8. C
